questions.question: She didn't allow me .................................. for the drink.
questions.description: Allow is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: I won't let you .................................... my room.
questions.description: Let is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: You ought .................................. a doctor.
questions.description: Ought is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: I was unable ................................... the question.
questions.description: Unable is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: Mother made me ................................ the room.
questions.description: Make is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I forgot ................................. the car.
questions.description: Forget is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: I heard them ....................................... in the next room.
questions.description: Hear is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: You needn't ....................................... for that drink.
questions.description: When need is a modal auxiliary, it is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: You don't need ...................................... for me.
questions.description: When need is an ordinary verb, it is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: You should encourage him .................................... another attempt.
questions.description: Encourage is followed by an infinitive with to.
